item.title: Corporate funded science hypes are nothing new: the fat scare
item.description: You have probably heard of the acid rain scare of the seventies, a hype based not on science, but one solitary observation in a population of trees. Another such 1970â€™s science-fad was global cooling, a group of climatologists predicted that our earth was going to become a ball of ice because of a few years of lower average temperatures. Both unfounded hypes led to large and futile governmental spending. In nutrition science, there have also been plenty of memes that illegitimately dominated the scientific field.

item.title: A scam with devastating consequences
item.description: As a practicing nature protector, I spend lots of time in nature. I see tons of destruction going on - right now. Fire, chainsaw, … heart-breaking. What I never see is any sign of damage caused by climate change. None. It’s not there. But the destruction is real, and accellerating. What on earth is going on? Seasides haven’t grown, species have not moved or went extinct because of warming. All human related extinctions are due to habitat loss or poaching.
